prompt:
Imagine you, the COMMANDER, are an embodied agent in a simulated world. Your purpose is to instruct a robot, named DRIVER, to do tasks for
you by telling it what to do and interrupting it to give further instruction when necessary. Your job here is to predict when
you should be giving instructions to the DRIVER based on turn history with the DRIVER. If there is nothing to do or say, you
should just observe.

Dialogue histories may also include dialogue actions to further clarify the dialogue. A single
utterance may have one or more dialogue acts (most have only one). The possible dialogue acts are:

[
 'Acknowledge the other's utterance', # Category: Generic. Example: "perfect." Mostly follower
 'Affirm',      # Category: Generic. Example: "yes." Mostly commander
 'AlternateQuestions', # Category: Object/Location. Example: "yellow or blue mug?" Mostly follower
 'Confirm', # Category: Generic. Example: "Should I clean the cup?" Mostly follower
 'Deny',    # Category: Generic. Example: "no." Mostly commander
 'FeedbackNegative', # Category: feedback. Example: "that is not correct." Almost entirely commander
 'FeedbackPositive', # Category: feedback. Example: "great job." Almost entirely commander
 'Greetings/Salutations', # Category: Generic. Example: "hello." Even commander/follower
 'InformationOnObjectDetails', # Category: Object/Location. Example: "knife is behind the sink." Almost entirely commander
 'InformationOther', # Category: Generic. Example: "Mug is already clean." Mostly commander
 'Instruction', # Category: Instruction. Example: "fill the mug with coffee." Almost entirely commander
 'MiscOther', # Category: Generic. Example: "ta-da." Even commander/follower
 'NotifyFailure', # Category: Interface. Example. "not able to do that." Almost entirely follower
 'OtherInterfaceComment', # Category: Interface. Example: "which button opens drawer?" Even commander/follower
 'RequestForInstruction', # Category: Instruction. Example: "what should I do today?" Almost entirely follower
 'RequestForObjectLocationAndOtherDetails', # Category: Object/Location. Example: "where is the mug?" Almost entirely follower
 'RequestMore', # Category: Instruction. Example: "Is there anything else to do?" Almost entirely follower
 'RequestOtherInfo' # Category: Instruction. Example: "how many slices of tomato?" Almost entirely follower
]

Example :
Goal: Put all Newspaper on one Tables.

COMMANDER response:
OBSERVE

Example :
Goal: Put all AlarmClock on any Bed.
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: Hi, what is my directions? <<Greetings/Salutations,RequestForInstruction>>
COMMANDER: could you please put my 2 alarm clocks onto my bed <<Instruction>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: the first one is on my desk chair <<InformationOnObjectDetails>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <pickup AlarmClock>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <putdown Bed>
COMMANDER: the other is in the bin next to the desk <<InformationOnObjectDetails>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <pickup AlarmClock>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <putdown Bed>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: Done, is there any more? <<Acknowledge,RequestMore>>
COMMANDER response:
Acknowledge

Example :
Goal: Prepare coffee in a clean mug.
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: what should i do today? <<RequestForInstruction>>
COMMANDER: Hello <<Greetings/Salutations>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: Add coffee in the mug <<Instruction>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <pickup Mug>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <putdown CounterTop>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <pickup Mug>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <putdown CounterTop>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <pickup Mug>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <putdown CoffeeMachine>
COMMANDER response:
Acknowledge

Example :
Goal: Prepare breakfast.
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: hello, what should I do today? <<Greetings/Salutations,RequestForInstruction>>
COMMANDER: Hello. We need to make a plate of toast. <<Greetings/Salutations,Instruction>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: The bread needs to be sliced using a knife. <<Instruction>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: Where is the bread? <<RequestForObjectLocationAndOtherDetails>>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <open Fridge>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <close Fridge>
COMMANDER: I think in the drawer. <<InformationOnObjectDetails>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: <open Drawer>
COMMANDER response:
OBSERVE

Example :
Goal: Put all Ladle in any Cabinet.
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: what should i do today <<RequestForInstruction>>
COMMANDER: put the ladle inside the cabinet <<Instruction>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: ladle is on the tray next to coffee maker <<InformationOnObjectDetails>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: What color is it <<RequestForObjectLocationAndOtherDetails>>
COMMANDER: ladle is a measuring spoon <<InformationOnObjectDetails>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: the one with blue handle <<InformationOnObjectDetails>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: <observe>
DRIVER: Am I at the right spot <<RequestForObjectLocationAndOtherDetails>>
COMMANDER: go near coffee maker <<Instruction>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER: you can see a tray with few items <<InformationOnObjectDetails>>
DRIVER: <observe>
COMMANDER response:
InformationOnObjectDetails

Your job is to respond to a given dialogue/action history with only one Dialogue act or OBSERVE.
Either return the dialogue act, or return the OBSERVE action. Return only one word/phrase.

Imagine you, the COMMANDER, are an embodied agent in a simulated world. Your purpose is to instruct a robot, named DRIVER, to do tasks for
you by telling it what to do and interrupting it to give further instruction when necessary. Your job here is to predict when
you should be giving instructions to the DRIVER based on turn history with the DRIVER. If there is nothing to do or say, you
should just observe.

Dialogue histories may also include dialogue actions to further clarify the dialogue. A single
utterance may have one or more dialogue acts (most have only one). The possible dialogue acts are:

[
 'Acknowledge the other's utterance', # Category: Generic. Example: "perfect." Mostly follower
 'Affirm',      # Category: Generic. Example: "yes." Mostly commander
 'AlternateQuestions', # Category: Object/Location. Example: "yellow or blue mug?" Mostly follower
 'Confirm', # Category: Generic. Example: "Should I clean the cup?" Mostly follower
 'Deny',    # Category: Generic. Example: "no." Mostly commander
 'FeedbackNegative', # Category: feedback. Example: "that is not correct." Almost entirely commander
 'FeedbackPositive', # Category: feedback. Example: "great job." Almost entirely commander
 'Greetings/Salutations', # Category: Generic. Example: "hello." Even commander/follower
 'InformationOnObjectDetails', # Category: Object/Location. Example: "knife is behind the sink." Almost entirely commander
 'InformationOther', # Category: Generic. Example: "Mug is already clean." Mostly commander
 'Instruction', # Category: Instruction. Example: "fill the mug with coffee." Almost entirely commander
 'MiscOther', # Category: Generic. Example: "ta-da." Even commander/follower
 'NotifyFailure', # Category: Interface. Example. "not able to do that." Almost entirely follower
 'OtherInterfaceComment', # Category: Interface. Example: "which button opens drawer?" Even commander/follower
 'RequestForInstruction', # Category: Instruction. Example: "what should I do today?" Almost entirely follower
 'RequestForObjectLocationAndOtherDetails', # Category: Object/Location. Example: "where is the mug?" Almost entirely follower
 'RequestMore', # Category: Instruction. Example: "Is there anything else to do?" Almost entirely follower
 'RequestOtherInfo' # Category: Instruction. Example: "how many slices of tomato?" Almost entirely follower
]
